question: Vinay Dube was recently appointed as the new Chief executive officer of which Indian Airline?
explanation:
Mumbai based Indian Airline, owned by Wadia Group- GoAir has appointed Vinay Dube as its new chief executive officer. Vinay Dube had earlier served as the CEO of Jet Airways and also associated with Delta Airlines and American Airlines.
He joined GoAir in an advisory position last year and was placed in the role of full time CEO, which was vacant since the resignation of Cornelis Vrieswijk, last February.
